sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Hello and welcome to Euronews Now. It's Tuesday the 31st of May. It's good to have you with us. These are your top stories. After weeks of back and forth discussions, EU leaders agree to ban most Russian oil from the bloc's markets by the end of the year. Talks continue today to iron out the measure. Russian forces intensify their attack on Siviro-Donetsk, raising everything in their path in their push to control the key Ukrainian city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And inflation in Europe hits an all-time high at 7.5%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: From sunflower oil to gas, Europeans everywhere are feeling the pinch in more ways than one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: are feeling the pinch in more ways than one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: European Union leaders have agreed on a compromise plan to block more than two-thirds of Russian oil imports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It came after late-night talks at a summit focused on helping Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The watered-down embargo covers only Russian oil brought in by sea, allowing a temporary exemption for imports delivered by pipeline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: EU Council President Charles Michel announced the deal on social media, saying it will cut a huge source of financing for Russia's war machine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: To be very clear, this means that there's an immediate impact of 75% of Russian oil being affected by this measure, and that means that before the end of the year, almost 90% of imported Russian oil at the European level will be affected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Other elements in the package are also important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's the de-swifting of the spare bank.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There's a ban on insurance and reinsurance of Russian ships by EU companies, There is a ban on insurance and reinsurance of Russian ships by EU companies, a ban on providing Russian companies with a whole range of business services, and very important, the suspension of broadcasting in the European Union of three further Russian state outlets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Earlier, Ukraine's President, Vladimir Zelensky, had appealed to leaders to end internal arguments getting in the way of an oil ban and a sixth package of sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban had been blocking a total ban since his landlocked country gets more than 60% of oil from Russia via the Soviet-era Zhuzba pipeline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is a two-day summit and despite the lateness of the talks, EU leaders will return to look at other Ukraine-linked issues, such as food security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: EU leaders will struggle to pass a sixth package of EU sanctions against Russia, namely the one that includes an embargo on Russian oil because in particular the Hungarian government is refusing to pass this

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: saying that it relies too heavily on cheap Russian oil particularly from the Drogba pipeline. These are landlocked countries so from an infrastructure point of view it's very difficult. There could be a compromise where the EU agrees an embargo on seaborne oil coming into Europe which is around two-thirds of all oil and there will be a dispensation for countries using the Drozhba pipeline, which is the Czech Republic, Slovakia and Hungary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's not ideal, but I think there's an eagerness to get this package passed eventually.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Also on the agenda today here in Brussels as EU leaders meet for the next two days is the crisis in food security that's evolving as a result of the war in Ukraine. It's impossible to get important wheat and crops out of Ukraine because of the Russian blockade. This is affecting developing countries, particularly those in Africa. There's a concern that you could have starvation and famine in those countries if the issue is not resolved. Also tonight, the Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelensky, will address the leaders in relation to the war and in relation to support military support and also sanctions support Shona Murray Euronews Brussels Russian tanks and troops are said to have pushed further into the key

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian city of Severodonetsk it's triggered street-by-street fighting as the Kremlin's forces continue to grind forwards in the east of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Russian state aired this footage of the city claiming it was almost under the control of separatists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Witnesses said Russian tanks were advancing towards the centre of the city one blast at a time, raising everything in their path that remains after intense shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The city's mayor had said it was in ruins and tens of thousands of people had been driven from their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Experts surmise that the Kremlin has thought it cannot afford to waste time and should use the last chance to extend the separatist-controlled territory of Donbass because the arrival of Western weapons in Ukraine could make that impossible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But in an apparent setback for Ukraine, US President Joe Biden appears to have dismissed reports that the US was considering sending long-range rocket systems to the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We're not going to send a Ukraine rocket system that can strike into Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Russia's foreign minister, Sergei Lavrov, claims that what the Kremlin calls the liberation of the Donbass region remains an unconditional priority for Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: remains an unconditional priority for Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Inflation is continuing to soar across Europe, including in the leading economies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Germany's annual rate hit 7.9% in May, according to official figures, the country's highest level in almost 50 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The main culprit is energy prices that have risen by 38% year on year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But the Federal Office of Statistics says food prices in the Eurozone's largest economy are also up by 11.1%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The office also says Germans' earnings are down by 1.8% in real terms compared to a year ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The latest report from the International Labour Organization says people are being hit by multiple new and interconnected global crises. As well as inflation, they include supply issues, financial turbulence and the war in Ukraine, all of which is hitting people's pockets hard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We talk about the need to protect, as you would expect, the most vulnerable, those in most difficulty the need for social protection to be factored into the way governments are responding we're arguing for dialogue bringing together governments employers and workers to find acceptable solutions in situations which are undoubtedly very difficult that adds to the legitimacy and acceptability of solutions and the bad news is there's little sign of a situation improving anytime soon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In fact the ILO says things could deteriorate further in the coming months increasing the gap between the rich and the poorer nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The ILO says it's seeing a continuation of what it calls the great divergence in recovery trajectories between different income groups and that says the organization is something that should concern us all UEFA has commissioned an independent report into the chaos and violence

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: surrounding Saturday's Champions League final in Paris it follows several days of Liverpool fans and the French authorities blaming each other for the unrest which had delayed the start of the match with Real Madrid. On Monday France hit out at what it says was industrial scale ticket fraud amid a row over the game's policing. The major central pivotal point is to try to fully understand what happened on that massive ticket fraud and why in such a large number of tickets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But Liverpool fans, including a local MP who was at the game, blame the police and lack of UEFA staff. And once we got there, we'd just seen thousands of fans queuing to get in. No turnstiles of open. And all you could see around the ground was massive queues, no money gaining access.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And obviously then just becoming worse and worse and worse the situation and you know we witnessed police tear gas and pepper spraying and people with tickets between 30 000 and 40 000 british fans went to the stadium with fake tickets but real madrid supporters who only allowed the sale of electronic tickets appear not to have had any problem sky bridge 7 to 1 has opened in the Czech Republic and claims to be the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: longest suspension walkway in the world the pedestrian path stretches 721 meters between two mountain peaks and reaches 95 metres above ground at its highest point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The record was previously held by a similar design in Portugal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The World Health Organisation is calling for immediate action on World No Tobacco Day, urging everyone to commit to quit. While links between smoking and cancer are well known, killing 8 million people worldwide each year, tobacco production is also bad for the environment through the use of pesticides and deforestation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The industry also creates 84 tonnes of CO2.
